channel.title: Portfolios on Philip Mitroi
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolios on Philip Mitroi

item.title: LET ME SHOOT YOU
item.description:
Contact me to have your picture taken!

Contact me at contact@philipmitroi.com

item.title: The lady who gave me mangos
item.description:
After manning the street corner for a good ten minutes, my interest travelled to a small bulk shop. Apparently, the lady is Romanian and knows my mother somehow. I asked her for a picture and she gave me a picture and some dried mangos. What a kind person!

These are her wares

item.title: Walk Around March 21
item.description:
Quick zoom through the market before lunch

I used to shoot street with a 50mm on a d60. I still shoot 50mm on a crop sensor. It’s a little challenging getting used to zone focusing, but it’s just as fun as I remember it, and with this lens it’s practically too easy!

item.title: Stas in Kensington
item.description:
Literally accidentally ran into him and took some shots

Bought a 50mm prime this week after going almost 6 months without one. Although a downgrade from my previous AF-S lens, I feel like this old gem from the 70s will do just fine. Today, I feel like the camera is a natural extension of my self again.

item.title: Some Updates
item.description:
You probably noticed by now that my images don’t scale. This is the next step in the devellopment of this website, I am not the world’s greatest programmer, nor do I have the most experience deploying to the web, although design is not an issue. Throughout the programming of this site, I’ve learned a lot about Hugo, the generator I am using to create this website. Currently there is no native way to implmenet dynamic scaling to images, but the internet hasn’t slept on this.

In the next week, I plan to implement one of these two gallery solutions to the site for a better viewing experience. A gallery will allow me to consolidate more work in one page, and strengthen the intention of a personal website as a hub for my work, rather than stretching content across different platforms and sites.

https://www.liwen.id.au/photoswipe/

https://github.com/icecreammatt/hugo-gallery

Please feel free to contact me with advice regarding this devellopment. As a novice web dev, feedback is appreciated.

item.title: A view
item.description: I couldn’t resist but to snap this sunset

item.title: Fisherman's Warf
item.description: A colorful detail of a house on Fisherman’s Warf, in Victoria.

item.title: Stas
item.description:
A session with my friend Stas

Stas is one of my closest friends, he’s an emerging artist from Toronto who you can find on soundcloud under the moniker Yani. I think he and I go for a shoot at least once every week. On top of taking pictures for him, I also produce a great deal of music for him. In these industries I find it very important to have someone around who you can work with on anything, messages may be lost in translation should the aesthetic or message be limited to a single format. By allowing me to work with him on both visual and acoustic platforms, we achieve a unique aesthetic that is consistent all across the board of his brand, with more control than assembling content from sources produced by different people.

soundcloud.com/babyboiyani

Check out some more photos from the session below:

item.title: Musée des beaux-arts de Montréal
item.description:
Snapshot of Montréal

In a visit to Montréeal, I snapped this shot in the third floor of the Musée des beaux-arts. https://www.flickr.com/photos/philipmitroi/19425608906/

item.title: Somewhere in the Nevada Desert
item.description:
There’s no water and lots of cacti.

During a trip to Las Vegas, I spent some time exploring the surrounding area. See the full size picture at: https://www.flickr.com/photos/philipmitroi/14552709741

item.title: Art Gallery of Ontario
item.description:
Building Detail

I’m around the Art Gallery of Ontario a lot. See the full size picture at: https://www.flickr.com/photos/philipmitroi/19425608906/

item.title: Selection from a retail catalog
item.description:
A collection of images that were used for advertising and promo for my friend’s retail business.

Naturally, one of the first people I shot with was Stas. You can see other projects I’ve done with him on the website’s homepage, just look for his image! In a more corporate setting, you would probably find a team of people working on this project. Beyond the photographer, there would probably be a stylist and a team for hair/makeup, as well as someone to act as the project’s creative director. Luckily for us, Stas already has an affinity for luxury fashion and portraying it in a way that would make it appealing. As a person who is also interested in some of the brands that the store offers (Rick Owens, Supreme, Bape, etc), doing this project was a blast.

Check out some of the images below:
